item.title: Sara add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sara add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sara add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Sara add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sara add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sara add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Sara add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sara add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is to not stop questioning." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds the most discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but 'That's funny..." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Sara add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sara add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Sara add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Sara add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Sara add a quote by Maureen Corrigan
item.description: "It's not that I don't like people. It's just that when I'm in the company of others - even my nearest and dearest - there always comes a moment when I'd rather be reading a book." -- Maureen Corrigan

item.title: Sara add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, “Look, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Sara add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "When I got [my] library card, that was when my life began." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Sara add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "We read books to find out who we are. What other people, real or imaginary, do and think and feel... is an essential guide to our understanding of what we ourselves are and may become." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Sara add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sara add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
